docs.title: aWords
docs.text: Leave notes and paper cards at home and learn a foreign language anywhere with aWords.

docs.title: Plan
docs.text:
1. Flutter - web, aurora (android, ios).
  2. Dictionaries - FreeDict.
  3. API - authorization, registration, statistics, share access to cards and statistics.
  4. The ability to create your own list with the words.
  5. Sharing your lists with others both privately and publicly.
  6. Modes: pictures, native-words, words to learn, by description.
  7. The user's progress can be share to users.
  8. Children's mode - cute text etc...

docs.title: Server application
docs.text:
REST API written in Dart for flutter applications. This is an open-source application for learning a foreign language.

Available on Android, Aurora OS and Web (coming soon).

Loading...

docs.title: Libraries
docs.text:
name: server_awords
description: Server application aWords.
version: 0.0.1
publish_to: none

environment:
  sdk: ">=2.19.0 <3.0.0"

dependencies:
  # https://pub.dev/packages/args
  # Parses raw command-line arguments into a set of options and values.
  args: ^2.4.0
  # https://pub.dev/packages/drift
  # Drift is a reactive persistence library for Flutter and Dart, built on top of sqlite.
  drift: ^2.5.0
  # https://pub.dev/packages/encrypt
  # A set of high-level APIs over PointyCastle for two-way cryptography.
  encrypt: ^5.0.1
  # https://pub.dev/packages/get_it
  # This is a simple Service Locator for Dart and Flutter projects with some additional goodies 
  # highly inspired by Splat.
  get_it: ^7.2.0
  # https://pub.dev/packages/json_annotation
  # Defines the annotations used by json_serializable to create code for JSON serialization 
  # and deserialization.
  json_annotation: ^4.8.0
  # https://pub.dev/packages/mason_logger
  # A reusable logger used by the Mason CLI.
  mason_logger: ^0.2.4
  # https://pub.dev/packages/path
  # A comprehensive, cross-platform path manipulation library for Dart.
  path: ^1.8.3
  # https://pub.dev/packages/pointycastle
  # A Dart library for encryption and decryption. In this release, most of the classes are ports 
  # of Bouncy Castle from Java to Dart.
  pointycastle: ^3.6.2
  # https://pub.dev/packages/pub_updater
  # A Dart package which enables checking whether packages are up to date and supports 
  # updating them.
  pub_updater: ^0.2.4
  # https://pub.dev/packages/settings_yaml
  # Provide a very simple method to use yaml files for reading/writing an app's configuration.
  settings_yaml: ^5.0.0
  # https://pub.dev/packages/validated
  # The ultimate dart + flutter string validators.
  validated: ^2.0.0

dev_dependencies:
  # https://pub.dev/packages/build_runner
  # The build_runner package provides a concrete way of generating files using Dart code, 
  # outside of tools like pub.
  build_runner: ^2.3.3
  # https://pub.dev/packages/build_verify
  # Test utility to ensure generated Dart code within a package is up-to-date when 
  # using package:build.
  build_verify: ^3.0.0
  # https://pub.dev/packages/build_version
  # Include the version of your package in our source code.
  build_version: ^2.1.1
  # https://pub.dev/packages/drift_dev
  # This library contains the generator that turns your Table classes from drift 
  # into database code.
  drift_dev: ^2.5.2
  # https://pub.dev/packages/json_serializable
  # Provides Dart Build System builders for handling JSON.
  json_serializable: ^6.6.1
  # https://pub.dev/packages/mocktail
  # Mock library for Dart inspired by mockito.
  mocktail: ^0.3.0
  # https://pub.dev/packages/test
  # test provides a standard way of writing and running tests in Dart.
  test: ^1.19.2
  # https://pub.dev/packages/very_good_analysis
  # This package provides lint rules for Dart and Flutter which are used at Very Good Ventures.
  very_good_analysis: ^4.0.0+1

docs.title: Errors
docs.text:
All variants of errors processed by the server.

Response examples

Error 400
{
    "code": 400,
    "message": "Bad Request"
}
Error 401
{
    "code": 401,
    "message": "Unauthorized"
}
Error 403
{
    "code": 403,
    "message": "Forbidden"
}
Error 404
{
    "code": 404,
    "message": "Not Found"
}
Error 405
{
    "code": 405,
    "message": "Method Not Allowed"
}
Error 422
{
  "code": 422,
  "message": "Unprocessable Entity",
  "validates": [
    {
      "field": "email",
      "message": "Email is not match"
    }
  ]
}
Error 500
{
    "code": 500,
    "message": "{message}"
}

Response options

Status code Description 200 OK 400 Bad Request 401 Unauthorized 403 Forbidden 404 NotFound 405 Method Not Allowed 422 Unprocessable Entity 500 Internal Error

docs.title: Login
docs.text:
Role Guest

User authorization method

Method POST
/api/login

Body

Key Description email required, email validation password required, min 8, max 16 uniqueKey required, unique device key

Response example

Response 200
{
  "userId": 2,
  "token": "08/vJcV2PMsMhPCuphqh3+rRyfty844C1T54DYpcL6fFSiydysClXTaEFLmXh4U/ChFosVUitq35lOrnKkul8T0Drg/CIpO0VQMf1i0hhoI=",
  "uniqueKey": "my_device_key",
  "createAt": "2023-02-13T21:28:43.000"
}

Response options

Status code Description 200 OK 400 Bad Request 422 Unprocessable Entity 500 Internal Error

docs.title: Logout
docs.text:
Roles User | Admin

Removing an authorization token from the server

Method DELETE
/api/logout

Response example

Response 200
{
  "code": 200,
  "message": "Token deleted successfully"
}

Response options

Status code Description 200 OK 404 NotFound

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
Role Guest

User registration method

Method POST
/api/registration

Body

Key Description name required email required, email validation password required, min 8, max 16 uniqueKey required, unique device key

Response example

Response 200
{
  "userId": 1,
  "token": "08/vJcV2P8sMhPCuphqh3+rhyfty844C1T54DYpcL6fFSiydysOlXTaEFLmXh4U/ChFosVUitq35lP7wIlDprlAcsRDdPYyrShwAyTI+mZ0=",
  "uniqueKey": "my_device_key",
  "createAt": "2023-02-13T21:36:54.000"
}

Response options

Status code Description 200 OK 400 Bad Request 422 Unprocessable Entity 500 Internal Error

docs.title: User Create
docs.text:
Role Admin

Add user

Method POST
/api/users

Body

Key Description name required email required, email validation password required, min 8, max 16 uniqueKey required, unique device key

Response example

Response 200
{
  "id": 5,
  "name": "name",
  "email": "best10@email.com",
  "role": "user"
}

Response options

Status code Description 200 OK 500 Internal Error

docs.title: User Delete
docs.text:
Role Admin

Delete user

Method DELETE
/api/users/{id}

Response example

Response 200
{
  "code": 200,
  "message": "User deleted successfully"
}

Response options

Status code Description 200 OK 500 Internal Error

docs.title: User Item
docs.text:
Role Admin

Get user details

Method GET
/api/users/{id}

Response example

Response 200
{
  "id": 1,
  "name": "Оля",
  "email": "best1@email.com",
  "role": "admin"
}

Response options

Status code Description 200 OK 400 Bad Request 401 Unauthorized 403 Forbidden 404 NotFound 500 Internal Error

docs.title: User List
docs.text:
Roles Guest | User | Admin

Get a list of users

Method GET
/api/users

Response example

Response 200
[
  {
    "id": 1,
    "name": "Оля",
    "email": "best1@email.com",
    "role": "admin"
  },
  {
    "id": 2,
    "name": "Юля",
    "email": "best2@email.com",
    "role": "user"
  }
]

Response options

Status code Description 200 OK 500 Internal Error

docs.title: User Update
docs.text:
Role Admin

Update user data

Method PUT
/api/users/{id}

Body

Key Description name required email required, email validation password required, min 8, max 16 uniqueKey required, unique device key

Response example

Response 200
{
  "id": 5,
  "name": "name update",
  "email": "best10@email.com",
  "role": "user"
}

Response options

Status code Description 200 OK 500 Internal Error
